body.name: A Bride for the Duke of Ice: A Historical Regency Romance Novel (Brides of Convenience Book 7)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Powerful Love That Squashes The Evil and Melts The Ice For A Happy Future
reviews.reviewText: To desperate people needing a marriage for different reasons just happen to use the same Matchmaker ! The Duke needed it so he could get his inheritance. She needed to escape the clutches of her Evil Stepmother. Where he didn’t want any connection only a marriage only on of convenience. She wanted Love , Kindness, and Family. Everything she wasn’t getting in her home. They meet, a scandal, a betrothal, and a wedding all within days. This is a relationship doomed ! Not knowing, liking, or even wanting to be in this , how could they survive ? If that isn’t enough pressure, don’t rule out the Evil Stepmother showing her Ugly Head !Ivy Fester was the only daughter of the Baron of Hawkes. After her beloved Mother dies everything changes. Her father remarries and her Stepmother treats her no more than a servant . Plenty of chores, hardly any food, and no longer a Lady of the Ton.Ethan Williams the Duke of Icebrooke heart was frozen shut. No Love , Kindness or Emotions for him . Only he had to marry now . How will he find someone and remain Cold.?When the Matchmaker sets them up to meet at a Ball they immediately did not Click , somehow caught in a compromising situation the only thing to do is get betrothed . A quick wedding and lots of animosity . Was this any way to start a marriage ? Real or Fake ? Could they ever find Common Ground ? Or better yet would they both find the Love That They Needed ?Ivy and Ethan have a Remarkable story. Both desperate for Love and family . Only he doesn’t know it and is she strong enough to open his heart to it ? Beautifully Written and Emotionally Touching. The Evil Stepmother does her darndest and the Duke becomes her Prince. Very Fairytale Like and Romantic !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The heroine has an evil stepmother, a drunken father and a nice step sister, but to get out of the house she goes to a matchmaker. The hero needs to marry to get some of his inheritance so he goes to a matchmaker. These two people don’t seem compatible, but to avoid a scandal they marry. Now come the hard part how do they live together with forces that wanting to pull them apart. It was a good read and you could understand why the hero was protecting his heart when he grew up without a mother and a very hard father.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Matchmaker Makes Another Match
reviews.reviewText: Ethan is given an ultimatum marry or lose your fortune so he goes to the matchmaker Margarita who matches him with Ivy. Now Ivy has basically had a Cinderella life where her stepmother is mean and delegated her to being the cleaning lady and all around servant. Ivy does have a loving sister, Celia, who tries to stick up for her whenever she could. Ivy was under the impression that she was only going to the ball as a partner to Ethan and did not think it was an engagement, which it initially wasn’t, as the two of them had a big disagreement upon first meeting each other. However circumstances forced them into actually setting a rather quick wedding date and so fate had stepped in to bring them together as a couple. Ethan did not have a nice childhood as his mother passed when he was little and his father became somewhat of a tyrant after her death so Ethan had never felt he was lovable and had never really wanted to be married. We then follow the story of them gradually opening up to each other so that a trickle of attraction slowly becomes a torrent as their love expands and grows. Of course we have a betrayal and forces that attempt to drive them apart but as in all love stories, true love is never denied.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This story was told very well so we can understand the cruelty one person shows another because they are so unhappy in their own life. This story was a Cinderella story in itself. The wicked stepmother who hates the daughter from her husband’s previous marriage. So the stepmother does everything in her power to humiliate the stepdaughter and because the father doesn’t care what’s going on, as long as he’s allowed to continue to drink. Only in this story Cinderella’s stepsister is on her said. As in the other story Cinderella gets the prince, but in this case the Duke and though their marriage start out with no love between them, they get to know each other and love grows. Leading them to their happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great Cinderella love story
reviews.reviewText: Ivy was so put down by her mean step-mother that she almost lost herself (and her drunk father was no help). Her step sister was a breath of fresh air for Ivy.Enter an “ice” Duke & a matchmaker, a marriage of convenience and an emotionally draining love story. Never sure what the other was really thinking.Ivy was naive & Ethan was very hard & cold —what could possibly go wrong?…..and don’t forget the very mean stepmother, always out to make Ivy’s life miserableI loved this story and feel Ava hit a home run with this oneYou’ll love it!!!!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars How Love Can Change Lives
reviews.reviewText: "A Bride for the Duke of Ice" by Ava MacAdams may seem to be a take on a fairy tale or two but is not meant for children. It was surprisingly spicy. The main characters were both children who endured abuse and neglect from their parents. This love story is about the way love can change the perception of how love can change your life. Both main characters grew into the people who knew they were lovable.I gave it 4 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cinderella and Beauty and the Beast in one story
reviews.reviewText: Ivy was a wonderful Cinderella, she was timid but not without a backbone. She was kind to those around her and especially to people who loved her. Agreeing to the letter from the matchmaker made it possible to achieve the dreams she always had.Ethan was seen as a Beast but inside had a heart that was protected by ice.The seamless blending between these stories made it enjoyable and refreshing. It makes me look forward to reading the next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A variation of Cinderella with the enslaved daughter and a wicked stepmother, this story also contained a handsome, broken prince and a wonderful stepsister. Ivy and Ethan had many obstacles to overcome, both past and present after a rocky beginning. They were delightful characters who recreated themselves as they should be seen, not as the past painted them.
Ethan and Ivy's story reminded me of Cinderella and beauty and the beast mixed together. I read it in an evening. I couldn't put it down!

I received this book as an ARC, and I am voluntarily leaving this review. An engrossingly insightful tale of a duty-bound man's faithful marriage in which nothing can change his commitment to his spouse, love blossoms gradually, and humorous banter and pranks are powerful enough to create a happy, fruitful family!

Being treated in an abominably cruel way by their own families, I understand Ivy and Ethan don't even think of letting anybody hurt them again. It's a fine line between protecting yourself and forsaking your own chance at happiness by pushing everybody away.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: SHE WANTS WHAT CAN NEVER GIVE HER - HE HAS BEEN HONEST THERE WILL NEVER BE LOVE
reviews.reviewText: LADY IVY - A very kind and much loved daughter as a child by her mother and father, everything changed with the death of her mother, her father drank a lot had no time for his young daughter he married again and had another daughter, whom Ivy LOVED very much. Ivy was happy until her stepmother dismissed all the servants and was told she had to take their place. (SHE was made to wear the uniform of a maid and carry out the duties of a maid) she reverted to this even calling her stepmother (Madam) she was never shown any love at all.Ivy knew her only way out was marriage - secretly visited a matchmaker who arranged for her to meet The Duke of ice brook at a ball - everyone knew of him by reputation but this would be her way out if all went well and she found a suitor.ETHAN DUKE OF ICE BROOK - a solitary man had a similar as Ivy - everyone feared him he had no feelings whatsoever - HIS uncle had ordered him to marry or he could loose some of his inheritance. He decided to go to a matchmaker who arranged a meeting for him at a ball.WELL IT ALL BEGINS HERE THEY HAVE NEVER MET EACH OTHER ALTHOUGH IVY KNOWS EVERYTHING ABOUT HIM AND IT'S NOT NICE.I absolutely loved this story the two main characters are brilliant - ETHAN makes his situation clear from the start.I COULD GO ON BUT I DON'T WANT TO SPOIL IT - READ IT YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED LOVED ETHAN (HOT).I received an ARC copy.

Ivy is now reduced to being a maid in her own home by her horrid stepmother. She needs to marry to escape her situation but she is thwarted by the evil ambitious woman who is trying to secure a titled husband for her own daughter Celia. So that is why Ivy enlists the help of a matchmaker. This matchmaker presents her with the iceberg duke as a suitor.Duke Ethan has guarded his heart away from love. His father always thought him beyond redemption and drilled into him his inabilities. But now has come the time for Ethan to find a proper wife and fully secure his inheritance. So the same matchmaker is consulted and her choice for him has him at a loss. Later on, a compromising situation arises and a hasty marriage follows for these two main characters.They are unhappily stuck together but things have a way of changing, bringing them more closer than they ever expected. The passion takes over.Ivy is a very endearing character; whilst doing her all to understand her frosty, to the point of unfeeling partner in life. Whilst Ethan is super icy. Throw into the mix some troublesome family members to upset things. Now how will these two come together? Ava works her magic making sure this fairy tale has a HEA and a pleasing extended epilogue to boot. Don’t miss this gem!
